docs.lead_paragraph: Main Street Advocacy is set to start an ad campaign on Wednesday that blames conservative groups like the Tea Party for the recent series of political losses in critical elections.

headline.main: In G.O.P., a Campaign Takes Aim at Tea Party
headline.print_headline: In G.O.P., A Campaign Takes Aim At Tea Party

docs.abstract: Open warfare is breaking out among rival Republican groups, with one, Main Street Advocacy, set to start an ad campaign that blames conservative groups like the Tea Party for series of political losses in critical elections across United States.
docs.snippet: Main Street Advocacy is set to start an ad campaign on Wednesday that blames conservative groups like the Tea Party for the recent series of political losses in critical elections.

docs.lead_paragraph: Race or ethnicity may be a factor in the success of fertility treatment, a new study suggests.
docs.abstract: Race or ethnicity may be a factor in the success of fertility treatment, a new study suggests.
docs.snippet: Race or ethnicity may be a factor in the success of fertility treatment, a new study suggests.

headline.main: During I.V.F., Keeping a Marriage Strong

docs.abstract: A loving partnership can make fertility treatments far easier to bear — but we have to protect our partnerships from the toll that in vitro fertilization can take.
docs.snippet: A loving partnership can make fertility treatments far easier to bear — but we have to protect our partnerships from the toll that in vitro fertilization can take.

headline.main: On the Chinese Internet, Big Interest in Smog's Threat to Fertility

docs.abstract: A passing reference to pollution’s effects on reproductive health in a government report on low-carbon development rivets public attention.
docs.snippet: A passing reference to pollution’s effects on reproductive health in a government report on low-carbon development rivets public attention.

headline.main: At West Point: Duty, Honor, Gay Marriage

docs.abstract: For months, the photographer Jill Knight had been following a couple of West Point graduates, who, on Saturday, sealed with a kiss the first male gay marriage at the military academy.
docs.snippet: For months, the photographer Jill Knight had been following a couple of West Point graduates, who, on Saturday, sealed with a kiss the first male gay marriage at the military academy.

docs.lead_paragraph: A ruling by the Oklahoma Supreme Court last week that a law violated the Constitution by effectively banning medicinal abortions apparently made the case less attractive to the higher court.

headline.main: Justices Decline an Appeal on Abortion
headline.print_headline: Justices Decline An Appeal On Abortion

docs.abstract: Supreme Court declines to hear appeal on decision striking down an Oklahoma abortion law, dismissing as 'improvidently granted' a case it had previously agreed to consider; latest ruling by Oklahoma Supreme Court that law violated the Constitution by effectively banning medicinal abortions apparently made case less attractive to the higher court.
docs.snippet: A ruling by the Oklahoma Supreme Court last week that a law violated the Constitution by effectively banning medicinal abortions apparently made the case less attractive to the higher court.

docs.lead_paragraph: Daniel Harris said that after her mother was killed at their home in Queens, she knew that she had to be strong for her son, who was born two months later.

headline.main: A Teenager’s Course, Altered by Motherhood
headline.print_headline: A Teenager’s Course, Altered by Motherhood

docs.abstract: Daniel Harris of Brooklyn takes GED classes and has started receiving public assistance thanks to help from Opportunities for a Better Tomorrow, beneficiary agency of Community Service Society.
docs.snippet: Daniel Harris said that after her mother was killed at their home in Queens, she knew that she had to be strong for her son, who was born two months later.

docs.lead_paragraph: For desperate patients, the pace of clinical drug trials can be lethally slow. But there is a way for them to beat the clock.

headline.seo: How Dying Patients Get Access to Experimental Drugs

docs.abstract: Darshak Sanghavi article describes how patients dying from cancer can obtain experimental drugs through a Food and Drug Administration program called compassionate access, in which pharmaceutical companies are allowed to offer them promising drugs that are still being tested.
docs.snippet: For desperate patients, the pace of clinical drug trials can be lethally slow. But there is a way for them to beat the clock.

headline.main: Babies Can Learn Music in the Womb
headline.print_headline: Childbirth: Learning Music in the Womb

docs.abstract: A new study suggests that babies can learn a melody they hear while still in the womb, and recognize it after they are born.
docs.snippet: A new study suggests that babies can learn a melody they hear while still in the womb, and recognize it after they are born.
